scenarioDescription:
The TOI-1260 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-1260 is a star with 0.66 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.65 times its radius. It is located 240.04 light years away from the solar system.

TOI-1260 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-1260 system


TOI-1260 b

TOI-1260 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-08, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-1260 b is 8.605 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-1260 b is 2.340 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-1260 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


TOI-1260 c

TOI-1260 c was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-08, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-1260 c is 11.807 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-1260 c is 2.820 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-1260 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TOI-1260, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TOI-1260 - System With 2 Exoplanets
